info.title: BBC Nitro API
info.description: BBC Nitro is the BBC's application programming interface (API) for BBC Programmes Metadata.

get.description: Fetch metadata about Programmes (brands, series, episodes, clips). By applying different filter restrictions this feed can be used in many ways, for example to retrieve all series belonging to a brand, all the episodes and/or clips for a specific series, or any TLEO objects for a masterbrand. Other filters permit restricting to specific formats and/or genres, and you can request specific versions (for example Signed or Audio-Described). Parameters may be combined in any way suitable for your application.
get.summary: Start here for programmes metadata: Brands, Series, Episodes and Clips

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sorts:
* sort numerically by position in group, ascending
* sort alphabetically by PID, descending
* sort numerically by position, ascending
* sort by promotion rank, ascending
* sort chronologically by release date, descending
* sort by weighting of search term (use with q parameter)
* sort chronologically by scheduled start time/date, ascending
* sort alphabetically by title, ascending
* sort by title librarian style (ignoring leading 'The', 'A', etc), ascending
* sort by root pid and then preorder tree sort. Requires entities to have release date.
* sort numerically by number of views (most popular first)

parameters.name: sort_direction
parameters.description: Sort direction

parameters.name: mixin
parameters.description:
Mixins:
* mixin to return the alternate images for a programme
* mixin to return ancestor programme titles
* mixin to return programme availability information
* mixin to return information about programmes that are currently available on demand
* mixin to return information about contributors to a programme
* mixin to return original version duration in programme concept entities
* mixin to return list of genre groupings
* mixin to add image information for a programme
* mixin to add embeddable information for a programme
* mixin to return the programmes which appear before and after a programme (as determined by the sort applied in the request)
* mixin to return information about related links to a programme
* mixin to return information about programmes that are currently available as webcasts

parameters.name: unstable_mixin
parameters.description:
Unstable mixins:
* mixin to return information about programmes that are currently available as webcasts

parameters.name: audio_described
parameters.description: filter for subset of programmes that are audio-described

parameters.name: availability
parameters.description: filter for subset of programmes that have availability

parameters.name: availability_entity_type
parameters.description: additional filter when availability=available

parameters.name: availability_type
parameters.description: filter for a subset of programmes that are available for a given type

parameters.name: children_of
parameters.description: filter for subset of programmes that have PID as immediate parent

parameters.name: descendants_of
parameters.description: filter for subset of programmes that have PID as ancestor

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: filter for subset of programmes that have given duration

parameters.name: entity_type
parameters.description: filter for subset of programmes that have given entity type

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: filter for subset of programmes with format

parameters.name: genre
parameters.description: filter for subset of programmes with genre

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: filter for subset of programmes which belong to the given group pid

parameters.name: initial_letter
parameters.description: filter for subset of programmes with title beginning with initial letter librarian style (ignoring leading 'The', 'An' (Welsh), etc) 0-9 a-z

parameters.name: initial_letter_end
parameters.description: Programmes with (librarian) titles whose initial letter is equal/before given letter. Use with initial_letter_start for a range

parameters.name: initial_letter_start
parameters.description: Programmes with (librarian) titles whose initial letter is equal/after given letter. Use with initial_letter_end for range.

parameters.name: initial_letter_strict
parameters.description: filter for subset of programmes with title beginning with initial letter

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: filter for subset of programmes with linked to versions which have the given item pids

parameters.name: master_brand
parameters.description: filter for subset of programmes with master_brand

parameters.name: media_set
parameters.description: filter for subset of programmes with media set

parameters.name: media_type
parameters.description: filter for subset of programmes with media type

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: which page of results to return

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: number of results in each page

parameters.name: partner_id
parameters.description: filter for programmes by partner ID

parameters.name: partner_pid
parameters.description: filter for programmes by partner PID

parameters.name: payment_type
parameters.description: filter for a subset of programmes that are of the given payment_type

parameters.name: people
parameters.description: filter for subset of programmes with contributions by given people PID

parameters.name: pid
parameters.description: filter for subset of programmes having given PID

parameters.name: promoted_for
parameters.description: filter for subset of programmes which are promoted for given service

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: filter for subset of programmes matching supplied keyword/phrase (boolean operators permitted)

parameters.name: signed
parameters.description: filter for subset of programmes that are signed

parameters.name: tag_name
parameters.description: filter for subset of programmes with tag

parameters.name: tag_scheme
parameters.description: filter for subset of programmes with a tag

parameters.name: tleo
parameters.description: filter for subset of programmes that are TLEOs

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: filter for subset of programmes with given PID as one of their versions

get.description: Fetch metadata about linear Broadcasts and Services, allowing the generation of Television and Radio schedules and other datasets for broadcast items. Use /schedules instead of this feed as it is more efficient. Broadcasts will be deprecated in the future.
get.summary: Build schedules and find metadata for TV and radio broadcasts

parameters.description:
Sorts:
* sort chronologically by scheduled start time/date, ascending

get.description: The People feed allows you to search for the people and groups that contribute to programmes. This is the starting point for cast and crew credits, as well as finding contributors using external IDs (such as Wikipedia URLs)
get.summary: Find the people behind and in programmes: cast, crew, guests and more

parameters.name: id_type

parameters.name: pid

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: filter for subset of people matching supplied keyword/phrase (boolean operators permitted)

parameters.name: page

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: number of results in each page

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: filter for subset of programmes matching supplied keyword/phrase (boolean operators permitted)

get.description: The services feed exposes the linear broadcast "services" from PIPs. These are the actual services which broadcast programmes (eg bbc_one_oxford is the service for BBC One in Oxford).
get.summary: Information about the linear services used for broadcast transmissions

parameters.name: end_from
parameters.description: Return services that end on or later than the specified datetime

parameters.name: end_to
parameters.description: filter for subset of broadcasts that end on or earlier than the specified datetime

parameters.name: mid
parameters.description: filter for services by masterbrand MID

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: which page of results to return

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: number of results in each page

parameters.name: partner_id
parameters.description: filter for services by partner ID

parameters.name: partner_pid
parameters.description: filter for services by partner PID

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: filter for subset of services matching supplied keyword/phrase (boolean operators permitted)

parameters.name: service_type
parameters.description: filter for specified type of linear services. one of: TV, Local Radio, National Radio, Regional Radio

parameters.name: sid
parameters.description: filter for specified linear service

parameters.name: start_from
parameters.description: Return services that start on or later than the specified datetime

parameters.name: start_to
parameters.description: Return services that start earlier than the specified datetime

get.description: The versions feed exposes editorial "Versions" of programmes. These are concepts used to capture different presentations of an overall programme: for example, versions of a programme may include one with sign language, one with audio description, one edited for content and more. Versions are also important to understand for broadcasts: a linear broadcast or an ondemand is always of a specific version, not merely of a programme.
get.summary: Metadata on editorial programme versions: original, signed, audio-described, etc

parameters.name: availability
parameters.description: filter for subset of versions that have availability

parameters.name: descendants_of
parameters.description: filter for subset of versions having given programme PID

parameters.name: media_set
parameters.description: filter for subset of versions with availability in the given media set

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: which page of results to return

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: number of results in each page

parameters.name: partner_id
parameters.description: filter for versions by partner ID

parameters.name: partner_pid
parameters.description: filter for versions by partner PID

parameters.name: payment_type
parameters.description: filter for a subset of versions that are of the given payment_type

parameters.name: pid
parameters.description: filter for subset of versions having given PID
